metadata.name: PowerShell Set-Acl On Windows Folder - PsScript
metadata.comment: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM script_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('set-acl ')) AND contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-aclobject ')) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path "c:\\windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path "c:/windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path \'c:\\windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path \'c:/windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path c:\\windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path c:/windows')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path $env:windir')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path "$env:windir')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('-path \'$env:windir'))) AND (contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('fullcontrol')) OR contains(lower(script.script_content.value), lower('allow'))))

output.summary: Detects PowerShell scripts to set the ACL to a file in the Windows folder
